candidates.name: Ryan Soriano
candidates.why_elect: As the DHB is embarking to provide its vision and values to be embedded by 2024. With the full participation of its leaders, staff and the community, It is a high time for me to represent what the people wanted the DHB would look like moving forward.
candidates.why_stand: I have lived my whole NZ life in the Wairarapa and I have strongly believed from the start that this is the best place to raise a family. If we have a strong regional health system, more and more people will love to live and stay here.

candidates.name: Jill Stringer
candidates.why_elect: I've live in the Wairarapa for 27 years, worked in health for 40, and now run my own business. I have a track record of working with people, groups, agencies and government for good outcomes. I want better results from the money we spend on health.
candidates.why_stand: I think we have good health services in the Wairarapa, but some of our health outcomes are not so great for Māori, children, those living with disability, disease or mental distress. I want Wairarapa people to live well, age well and have access to health services they understand and trust.

candidates.name: Don Baskerville
candidates.why_elect: I have worked in the procurement team in the Ministry of Health and I am a patient at Whaiora medical practice so I am connected to the local community while having professional financial skills.
candidates.why_stand: I will use my procurement and risk management experience to help manage the finances.

candidates.name: Stephen Butcher
candidates.why_elect: I have a background in architecture, contract management and cancer research. I believe I have the skills for fiscal responsibility at Board level and an appreciation of the changes we must make as a community to restore our quality of life.
candidates.why_stand: I have a passion for supporting enlightened health care for both our well-being and to secure the long term viability of our hospital and community health services.

candidates.name: Joy Cooper
candidates.why_elect: I have had many years experience in senior management roles across the health sector, including at Wairarapa DHB, ACC and the Ministry of Health, plus governance experience in the not-for-profit sector. I have the business acumen, knowledge and skills to make a strong contribution to Board decisions.
candidates.why_stand: I believe fervently that everyone should have easy access to good health care and I want to help Wairarapa DHB ensure you are able to receive the best care possible from the resources available, when, how and where you need it.

candidates.name: Norman Gray
candidates.why_elect: I am devoted and loyal to the Wairarapa and its Health Services. I have decades of front line experience in health. I also have experience in planning and implementation through a secondary career in the army reserve. This experience has been gained locally and overseas.
candidates.why_stand: I believe we are in a crisis with loss of services from the Wairarapa because of loss of autonomy to the larger health boards in the Hutt and Wellington. We need board members with an awareness of what is happening at ground level.

candidates.name: Peter McCardle
candidates.why_elect: My over 15 years of experience in health at a Government and board level have provided me with real insight into how health services are planned and resourced at a high and district level. With a budget of over 140 million, there are many priorities to balance.
candidates.why_stand: I have gained knowledge and experience as a Cabinet Minister, on the Hutt Health Board, and Senior Advisor to two Health Ministers. Having had my life saved by the public health system, I want to give something back.

candidates.name: Helen Pocknall
candidates.why_elect: I am a registered nurse with extensive experience having worked in community and hospital settings and with NGOs, and in a senior leadership role. I believe I have a very good understanding of the challenges that face our population and our health system's ability to meet the growing need.
candidates.why_stand: I believe the people of the Wairarapa deserve to receive the best quality health care with the ability to access services as close to home as possible. I can add value to the governance of our health system as a registered nurse and with my extensive experiential health system knowledge.
